titleproper.value: Guide to the Carol Weiss King FOIA Files <num>TAM 394</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-05-29T15:30:57</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: Carol Weiss King (1895-1952) was a prominent immigration attorney, civil rights activist, founding member of the National Lawyers Guild and author/editor of numerous legal publications.  She was also the subject of FBI file 100-49864, the result of a ten-year surveillance.  The collection contains portions of King's file in the form of a Vaughn Index generated by the FBI in compliance with the decision of the US Court of Appeals, DC Circuit, in the case <emph render="italic">Cynthia King v. United States Department of Justice</emph> (1987).

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
Donated by Cynthia King in 2007. The accession number associated with this gift is 2007.016.

Source:
Ginger, Ann Fagan, <emph render="italic">Carol Weiss King, Human Rights Lawyer</emph> (Niwot, CO: University Press of Colorado, c1993).

It should be noted that some portions of the index appear twice.  In a number of instances, however, the annotations are different. Also, a significant portion of the file is a summary, created in 1951,  of surveillance from 1941 through 1951.

corpname.value: American Committee for Protection of Foreign Born
